title: Part 1. Intro
description: It has been a while since the last time I have written something in this blog, or, as a matter of fact, it has been a while since I have written any code for myself.

title: Part 2. Gaming achievements in CRM
description: So, what is GameForce? A couple of years ago, I was working in a consultancy firm as a Salesforce Developer, and I noticed that users got really excited when they saw “the confetti” effect after completing the path of the opportunity or lead.

title: Part 3. Pros Cons and Pitfalls of an open-source project
description: As I’ve mentioned in the last article, this is the first time I am going to try to maintain an open-source project. And this brings a set of unique considerations that I would need to take into account.

title: Part 4. Backend
description: In this article, I will try to explain how the backend of the solution was designed. Contrary to the previous article in this series this is the topic where I have quite a lot of expertise.

title: Part 5. Setting up CI/CD for Salesforce using GitHub Actions
description: There is this thing that I like to call a CI/CD paradox — there is never a good time to set it up. In the early stages of the project, it might sound like an overkill to spend time on CI/CD configuration, while you still don’t have any real code to test.

title: Part 6. A pop-up dilemma
description: We’ve finally arrived at the point of the most vague part of the project — showing an achievement notification to the user.

title: Part 7. MVP
description: 2023 ended on a high note — GameForce has reached an MVP status. There are still a lot of things that need to be done before it can be published in an AppExchange but the core of the solution is finished.

title: Part 8. Solution packaging and underlying issues with contribution
description: In the previous article, I've described what functionality the first version of GameForce will have. At this point, I am planning to make some small improvements here and there, but the bulk of the work is done.
